pros: flexible, consistent, kind, helpful, opportunity to learn new skills
cons: long commute, but honestly nothing else

review_title: RCNJ is a Great regional College who treats student employees well.
pros: I received a housing stipend and meal plan when I worked for Ramapo College college as a student.  I received great training and was confident in my ability to perform well as an RA with the college.  student staff receive great support from supervisors and other departments that we work closely with (CSI, Student affairs, Public safety, etc...). Strong set of values and expectations that help you build identity capital and an administrative skill set that will serve you after college.
cons: There are very few cons that I experienced as a student employee of the college.  Occasionally I would disagree with certain aspects of presentations held by other departments during staff training, but it's a liberal arts institution so these types of characters are expected to be present in some departments.

pros: It’s great working as a Student Aide because the employees understand that we are student. We learn a great day of time management working for the campus offices and I enjoy it a lot. You get the chance to network with your coworkers as well as make friends. It’s a great environment to work in and I definitely enjoy it a lot. I have been working on campus since my freshmen year and do not regret a single day.
cons: Student should be allowed or given a few extra hours to work not just 15 hours per week. I know it’s the maximum but I feel that we should be able to make that choice.  I understand our education comes first and I totally agree with it.

review_title: Great people to work with, beautiful campus environment, excellent benefits!
pros: I'm relatively new in comparison with long term employees. Most employees are here for the very long term so that speaks volumes about the culture. Everyone I have encountered has been welcoming and helpful in my transition into Higher Ed. My experience and ideas are valued. Summer hours (Fridays off), Much better than average benefits.Beautiful campus and many nice perks including free tuition for employees and good discount for family members.Free gym on campus.Real sense of being a part of the community.
cons: Pay is quite a bit lower than the corporate world, but the other benefits have value to help balance that out.

job_title: Art Director in New York, NY
pros: I loved that I could work in the field that I was going to school for simultaneously. It was an excellent experience and a great source of income while in school. My employers were always advocates of school coming first but it gave me experience that I needed to deal with clients and an adult work environment. I had a hand in hiring my successor as well, which was awesome. I was even allowed to work over the summer! I LOVED everything about working here.
cons: I think the only downfall (and I can't really even say downfall really) was that students are capped at 20 hours a week because they are part time.

review_title: This is why we need Chris Christie!!!
pros: only a 35 hour woorkweek and that is full-time. generous time off and great NJ state benefits
cons: lazy lazy people. complain, union crazy... have super benefits and only a thirty five hour work week and still complain! no wonder NJ is broke! Christie needs to do something about these pensionistas that just hang out waitng for retirement. i worked with someone who did nothing and they couldn't get rid of her....ridiculous!

pros:
good work environment
sense of belongingness
flexible hours
technical work
well behaved coworkers and supervisors
regular increase in salary
diverse workplace
cons: I don't really have any downsides of working there. If I really have to point out one then it would be having a lounge for commuters students working there.

review_title: RCNJ throws out their employees like yesterday's trash

cons: The administration at Ramapo is incredibly disorganized.  They randomly make decisions without consult and can change the entire work experience for the worse in a very short period of time.

pros: I got the opportunity to work from home during the summer of 2016 and also enjoyed having flexible work hours.  If that wasn't enough, my supervisor was always supportive and willing to provide much-needed advice.
cons: Honestly, I wouldn't say there were any downsides to working for Ramapo as a student assistant for 1-1/2 years.
